data.title: BOLOGNA. Paolo III (Alessandro Farnese), 1534-1549. Wh…
data.meta_description:
BOLOGNA.  Paolo III (Alessandro Farnese), 1534-1549.  
White with armlet Ciocchi del Monte.  Ag gr. 4.86 Dr. PAVLVS III PONT MAX. Bust r. with zucchetto and cope decorated with lilies. Rv. BONONIA MATER STVDIORVM. Vexilliferous lion rampant toward s.; at s. armetta Ciocchi del Monte surmounted by cardinal's hat.  Munt. 99; B. 927; Ch. 313.
Very Rare.  Retouched coin. Nice BB

Provenance: Negrini Auction No. 25, November 28, 2007, Rambaldi collection, lot 159. The Ciocchi del Monte family drew their surname from Monte S. Savino town in the territory of Arezzo where they were originally from.
Innocenzo del Monte was born in Borgo S. Donnino (Fidenza) in 1532 to a servant of the then Cardinal Giovan Maria del Monte at that time Legate of Parma and Piacenza. As a boy he came into the good graces of the cardinal, who conceived an extraordinary affection for him. He not only cared for his education but wanted him with him when he went to Trent in 1545 as Papal Legate to the Council.
